job description:
Under general direction of the Director of Controls&Accountability, provide high-level analytical and problem solving support in the areas of internal controls, ethics, accounting, higher education administration, relevant legal and regulatory requirements and financial analysis. Develop or enhance processes to find and mitigate control weaknesses. Monitor financial compliance and perform high level financial reporting. Position will also provide advice and support to fiscal officers across campus in support of the overall mission of the division. Act on behalf of the Director in his/her absence.

Physical Demands:

Work on a personal computer for extended periods of time.

Occasionally lift boxes of office supplies or files weighing 25 lbs.

Work Environment:

Must be able to work overtime.

Limited vacation usage during peak workload periods. Restricted vacation near beginning of the academic quarters and fiscal close.

Employee is personally responsible for following safety guidelines/procedures.

UC Davis is a smoke and tobacco free campus effective January 1, 2014. Smoking, the use of smokeless tobacco products, and the use of unregulated nicotine products (e-cigarettes) will be strictly prohibited on any UC Davis owned or leased property, indoors and outdoors, including parking lots and residential space.

Background Check Required:

This position is a critical position and subject to a background check. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of background investigation including criminal history and identity checks.

Yes

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or finance-related field.

Minimum of five years as a financial or data analyst.

Experience using SQL queries and producing ad-hoc reports.

Experience with automated financial systems.

Experience analyzing financial issues in a multi-fund source, public service environment and presenting complex data in a way to facilitate decision-making.

Experience working with and understanding complex financial data attributes to analyze data, build reports and define requirements.

Experience working with budgets, generally accepted accounting principles, fund accounting and financial management practices.

Experience in preparation of statistical and financial data for business

planning and evaluation.

Analytical skills to map functional and system processes in support of

systems.

Analytical, problem-solving and management skills to independently research, develop and recommend solutions to complex problems and issues.

Experience in a customer service oriented environment.

Oral and written communication skills for individual, group and formal presentation settings, and to interact effectively with diverse communities and senior leaders.

Experience with computers including software programs/applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, etc.).

Preferred Qualifications:

CPA license or other financial/audit certificate.

Knowledge of University and College fund accounting.

Working knowledge of the National Association of College and University Business Officers (NACUBO).

Experience working with records covered by HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) and FERPA (Federal Educational Rights and Privacy Act).

Experience with UC financial systems (e.g., DaFIS, KFS, BANNER, etc.).

Experience auditing.
